ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: No one may touch it except the purified.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Only they can reach it who are clean (of mind).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: which none but the pure may touch;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: no one can touch it except the purified ones.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: None may touch it, except with ablution.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Which none touches but the pure ones.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: None shall touch it save the purified ones.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: none but the purified shall touch,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Which none toucheth save the purified,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: which none can touch except the purified.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Which none can touch except the purified.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: —no one touches it except the pure ones—
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Which none shall touch but those who are clean:
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Which (that Book with Allah) none can touch but the purified (i.e. the angels).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: which none shall touch except the purified;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: None can grasp it except the purified.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: None touch it except the purified.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [56:79] which none touch (lā yamassuhu is a predicate functioning as a prohibitive command) except the purified, those who have purified themselves of ritual impurities,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Which none toucheth) i.e. the Guarded Tablet (save the purified) from ritual impurities and sins, i.e. the angels; it is also said that this means: none acts upon the Qur'an except those who are given success,
